We Are EA  And we make games - How cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is challenging. That's why we employ the most creative and passionate people in the industry.  Fly your starfighter against the Empire. Score the winning touchdown. Yup - It's the coolest job on the planet!  The Challenge Ahead: Come act with the curiosity and courage it takes to experiment and lead. Partner with senior technology leaders at EA not just as a “trusted advisor” but as a strategic influencer . We help our business partners accomplish their business objectives within their financial constraints. Come prepared to articulate the “why” behind the numbers as you distill complexity and promote transparency. You’ll work independently as well as collaborate across diverse teams including Engineering Leadership, Technology Infrastructure, Game Studio Finance, Procurement, Global Sourcing, and Accounting.  What this Senior Financial Analytics Associate will do at EA: You will manage Opex and Headcount for EA’s growing Digital Platform (EADP) teams, an area essential to achieving our digital strategy. You will report to the Sr. Manager of Finance supporting the CTO (Chief Technology Officer) organization and be based in either Austin, TX or Redwood City, CA.  You will demonstrate a foundation in traditional FP&A responsibilities including:  Business Partnering – be the finance liaison to enable business owners’ success Financial Reporting – lead financial reviews, conduct variance analysis Monthly and Quarterly Close – prepare accrual and reclass entries to reflect accurate accounting Financial Modeling – analyze financial data to identify trends, savings opportunities, and return on investment  We are pioneering the future of FP&A by using technology in exciting ways! We want you to share our passion for analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive), automation, information systems, and data visualization.  EA’s next great Senior Financial Analytics Associate also needs to have:  Education  Bachelor’s degree with a preference for Finance, Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Analytics, or Mathematics. Extra considerations for Master level degrees  Experience  3+ years’ experience in business analytics or finance, preferably supporting a technology organization  Technical Skills  Expert Excel skills (model building, advanced formulas and arrays, Power Query) Relational databases and data integration Business Intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Looker)  Experience with one or more of the following preferred : Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) Structured Query Language ( SQL ) Python or R  What’s in it for you? Glad you asked!  We realize it takes outstanding people to make outstanding games, so we offer great compensation packages and a culture that values creativity and individuality.  We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages , tuition reimbursement , 401k with company match , of course, free video games! 7 days ago report job

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward. Consultant, Predictive Analytics RWS (Real-World Solutions)Technology Platforms The Role: This is an exciting role for a Predictive Analytics Consultant who is keen to help shape and grow a high profile and highly motivated predictive analytics team at the cutting-edge of life science. You will be exposed to both tier 1 and emerging pharmaceutical clients, diverse disease areas, complex healthcare challenges and market-leading anonymized patient datasets. This is an unrivalled opportunity to accelerate your career in an exciting direction. The role will encompass a mix of delivery and business development responsibilities including: First, you will oversee the design and delivery of advanced statistical / machine learning projects for US clients, such as developing algorithms to find undiagnosed patients with rare conditions. You will assume day-to-day responsibility for projects, oversee multiple work streams involving data scientists, clinical experts, client presentations, etc., demonstrating critical thinking, intellectual engagement and maturity. Second, you will support business development initiatives, including qualifying leads from clients, writing proposals, pitching to clients, etc. Throughout, you will work closely with internal stakeholders from around the business to ensure the proposed solution is truly innovative and provides an exciting value proposition to clients. Third, as you grow into the role, you will assume increased mentorship responsibilities, leading and inspiring other team members, serving as the go-to person for predictive analytics solutions, collaborating with software engineers and data scientists to improve the efficiency and quality of project deliverables, presenting at conferences and engaging in a variety of thought leadership initiatives. As a functional consultant you will work along side data scientists who will provide expertise on how and when to use advanced statistical / machine learning methods; you will require a strong existing foundational analytical knowledge coupled with an enthusiasm to deepen your understanding of advanced statistical and machine learning methods. The ideal candidate will have: A strong analytical background and a desire to upskill in predictive analytics / machine learning A deep understanding and excitement for the application of statistics/machine learning in healthcare/life sciences and the pharmaceutical industry Experience in healthcare / life sciences with focus on strategic business cases for analytics services or products Strong capability in managing analytics projects and priorities so that deadlines are met while retaining consistently high-quality deliverables Experience of working in multi-disciplined teams Experience of developing credible relationships with senior level managers and executives Knowledge of key issues and current developments in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries Demonstrable analytical, interpretative and problem-solving skills Inquisitiveness, attention to detail, ability to assess challenges Excellent presentation, communication and client-facing skills Well-developed written and verbal communication skills including presentations, small group facilitation, business and analytics report writing Prior experience with software packages such as R, Python, Matlab and SAS would be desirable but not required Knowledge of consulting methodologies, tools and techniques would be desirable but not required. In addition to the skills and experience above, candidates interested in joining as a Consultant will ideally have: Experience in life sciences, engineering, business, or other quantitative fields A postgraduate qualification in life sciences, statistics or a related discipline is desirable although not essential Experience in healthcare consulting or exposure to the life science sector industry Excellent conversational and business English (written and oral). The Team: You will join this high profile team to work on ground-breaking problems in health outcomes across disease areas including Ophthalmology, Neurology, chronic diseases such as diabetes, and a variety of very rare conditions. The Predictive Analytics team, comprising client-facing consultants, data scientists and software engineers, work hand-in-hand with statisticians, epidemiologists and disease area experts across the wider global RWS team, leveraging a vast variety of anonymous patient-level information from sources such as prescriptions, claims and electronic health records. The data encompasses IQVIA’s access to over 530 million anonymized patients as well as bespoke, custom partnerships with healthcare providers and payers. Our Predictive Analytics team within the Real World Solutions (RWS) Technology Platforms division is a fast-growing group of collaborative, enthusiastic, and entrepreneurial individuals. In our never-ending quest for opportunities to harness the value of Real World Evidence (RWE), we are at the center of IQVIA’s advances in areas such as machine learning and cutting-edge statistical approaches. Our efforts improve retrospective clinical studies, under-diagnosis of rare diseases, personalized treatment response, disease progression predictions, and clinical decision-support tools. We are looking for a creative, innovative, intellectually curious and entrepreneurial Predictive Analytics Consultant to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to work in one of the world's leading RWE teams working with Real World patient data to help our clients answer specific questions globally, make more informed decisions and deliver results. We invite you to join IQVIA™. IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential. Join Us Join Us Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients. Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning. IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled IQVIA, Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation. 1 day ago report job

The Northern Trust Company seeks a Consultant, Risk to be responsible for performing independent risk model validation and assessing the accuracy and performance of quantitative models and qualitative estimations across the organization.  Specific Responsibilities  Provide technical and theoretical expertise to evaluate the conceptual and theoretical soundness of model design, validity of selected model methodologies and assumptions, effectiveness of model development approaches, and integrity and representativeness of the data.  Ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulatory requirements for model risk. Evaluate existing model risk framework and validation requirements and actively provide solutions to enhance the model risk framework.  Provide communication and support training efforts to promote understanding of model risk measurement throughout the company.  Perform reviews of bank-wide quantitative models including models used for CECL and CCAR/DFAST stress testing, credit risk loss projections (PD, LGD, EAD), interest rate risk models, AML (Anti-Money Laundering and Fraud Detection), and various vendor models.  Use statistical models that involve least squares regression, logistic regression, Value-at-Risk, Monte Carlo simulation, and machine learning methodologies. Perform analyses using statistical programs such as SAS, R, or Python.  Review model documents, and conduct test runs on model codes.  Assess and measure the potential impact of model limitations, parameter estimation, error and/or deviations from model assumptions; compare model outputs with empirical evidence and/or outputs from model benchmarks.  Document and present observations to Model Validation Team Lead and to model owners and users, recommend remediation action plans, track remediation progress and evaluate remediation evidence.  Monitor model performance reports on an on-going basis to ensure models remain valid, as well as contribute in the bank-wide model risk and control assessment.  Support development of comprehensive documentation and testing of risk management framework.  Deliver a work product that requires little revision.  Establish and maintain strong relationship with key functional stakeholders such as model developers, model owners, and users.  Requirements  Position requires a Master’s degree in Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Business Administration, or a related field, and 1 year of experience developing, implementing, or validating quantitative models within risk management. Experience must include a minimum of:  2 years of experience with any three of the following tools: SAS, R, Python, in addition to SQL;  2 years of experience developing advanced statistical predictive models, including linear and logistic regression, time series techniques, and machine learning  2 years of experience with conducting statistical analysis handling large amounts of data  2 years of experience with understanding corporate financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements, and applying regulatory requirements for model risk  1 year of experience with utilizing modeling techniques supporting Capital Planning, CECL, Stress Testing (DFAST and CCAR), Pricing models, and Marketing models.  About Northern Trust: Northern Trust provides innovative financial services and guidance to corporations, institutions and affluent families and individuals globally. With 130 years of financial experience and nearly 20,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.  Working with Us: As a Northern Trust partner, you will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture, which has a strong history of financial strength and stability. Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company that is committed to strengthening the communities we serve!  We recognize the value of inclusion and diversity in culture, in thought, and in experience, which is why Forbes ranked us the top employer for Diversity in 2018.  We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and ethical companies.  Build your career with us and apply today. 4 days ago report job

It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. The performance of our product critically impacts the experience of our user base, influencing adoption, retention, as well as our ability to monetize. Using your affinity for synthesizing and visualizing data, you’ll ensure we’re making the best investments for our Pinners and our business. Panasonic – Senior Quantitative Researcher  Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.  Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.  Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us. What You’ll Get to Do: The Smart Mobility Office within Panasonic acts as an incubation engine to capture new opportunities and become a gamechanger in the rapidly transforming transportation industry. We are harnessing our own disruptive technologies to advance vehicle-to-everything (V2X) technology that transforms each vehicle into a true IoT device and leverages this data to revolutionize traffic management and safety on our roadways. The Cirrus/V2X Analytics, Research, and Insights team represents the Voice of the Customer, serving as the single source for customer, market, technical, and competitive intelligence data and truth for the organization. By executing on this, we help the business to make more-informed, and therefore less risky, business decisions while ensuring our customers remain at the center of our decision-making process. As the Sr. Quantitative Researcher, you will establish and build what the Quantitative Research discipline can be for the Cirrus/V2X team. You will independently gather, assimilate, analyze, and present timely, relevant insights gleaned from quantitative data to a wide variety of stakeholders. You work will shape the strategic direction of our business by providing strategic recommendations that inform our marketing, business strategy, and product development decisions. In this role you’ll partner with Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Data Scientists, Engineers, academics, and external stakeholders to identify deep insights and communicate them across the team and company. You’ll conduct generative and evaluative explorations to inform the Cirrus/V2X team Conceive, lead, and conduct research studies that drive strategic and tactical business and product decisions. Work with a wide range of business partners, particularly in analytics and product management, to develop innovative end-to-end solutions that address top outcomes, and iteratively design and test these solutions until outcomes are achieved or hypotheses are proven wrong. Find creative and compelling ways to present and showcase the insights throughout the company, in order to help cultivate a highly informed, more effective, and more strategic organization. Define and execute (and, as necessary, invent) research methods appropriate to the questions at hand, including but not limited to surveys, A-B tests/experiments, etc. Lead the strategic growth of this discipline on the research team, building strong relationships with the Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Design teams.  What You’ll Bring: Education & Experience: Master’s or PhD in computational social sciences (e.g. economics, sociology, psychology), statistics, computer science, related field, or equivalent practical experience 5+ years conducting quantitative research in an applied industry setting Experience in quantitative research methods—including survey design and implementation, advocate, set up, and analyze analytics, apply descriptive and interferential statistics (t-test, ANOVA) when appropriate, modeling large datasets Broad experience with the full range of quantitative research methods: survey design & sampling, data analysis and statistical modeling (descriptive and inferential statistics), A/B testing & experimentation, with some experience in behavioral analytics Experience with programming language(s) commonly used for data manipulation and computational statistics, i.e. SPSS. Python, R, SQL, etc. Experience with data visualization and analysis tools, i.e. Tableau, Spotfire, etc. Experience working with consumer analytics and insights, i.e. satisfaction, retention, churn, loyalty, etc. Preferred experience working in an agile product environment Preferred experience mentoring junior team members in advanced analytics Competencies: Self-starter with a desire to tackle complex business problems by collaborating with both partners and peers A true team player – flexible about your role Insatiable curiosity and lifelong learner Comfortable in a fast pace environment with changing or ambiguous requirements Strong analytical skills and good intuition with numbers, connecting the dots, synthesizing disparate information sources and sometimes contradictory learning Is an innovator who wants to improve the world for others Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze situations and identify existing or potential problems Knowledge of design thinking, human centered design Radically candid with the ability to challenge the status quo and current thinking Desire, willingness, and ability to teach and mentor others Communications: Highly collaborative Exceptional written, verbal, and visual communication skills; ability to distill complex ideas into concise and accurate narratives that enlighten and inspire. Communicate in a way that is easily understood and visually compelling, persuading partners to turn insight into action and actively work to influence the adoption of the recommendations. Other Requirements: Ability to travel to customer locations as required of the position. Up to 25% annually  What We Offer: Competitive compensation package Comprehensive benefits Pet Insurance Paid Parental Care Leave Employee Referral Program Educational Assistance Flexible Work Program Volunteer time Off Casual Dress Code Total Well Being Program Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Corporation of North America. Panasonic - 1 day ago report job

Sr Data and Analytics Professional Job Summary The Sr Data and Analytics Professional leverages their business knowledge, analytics domain expertise, and data expertise to perform an extensive gap assessment of the organization. This individual will actively engage with the SB Functional Teams by participating in initiative shaping discussions, managing their expectations, and collaborating with partners across the enterprise. The Sr Data and Analytics Professional is responsible for conceptualizing and delivering the optimal analytical solution to meet business’s needs. They will also continuously monitor the performance of implemented solutions via KPIs, deliver valuable insights, and assist the Business in making data-driven fact-based decisions.  Essential Functions (primary functions and/or reasons the job exists in order of importance) 1. Performs capability gap assessment for functional areas of the business to assist in developing use cases for analytical solutions to business problems by leveraging knowledge of current state, current processes, future needs, industry trends, best practices, etc. 2. Provides strategy support through decision analytics and research including, but not limited to, executive summaries, hypothesis testing, data exploration, experimental design, operations research, and third-party insights. 3. Conducts comprehensive data analysis spanning internal and external data sources such as financial, competitor, marketplace, and third-party data analysis. 4. Builds end to end analytical solutions to solve complex business problems by designing, implementing and operationalizing automated data / insights delivery and processes at POS (Point of Sale), etc. 5. Builds and maintains learning models to support business use cases and ensure integration within Customer, Employee / Agency and Policy Planforms. 6. Prepares, cleanses, and manipulates high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources in order to highlight patterns, anomalies, relationships, and trends. 7. Performs descriptive and diagnostics analysis to provide actionable insights for a range of business customers via effective data visualizations. 8. Engages and communicates with the business leaders through initiative shaping discussions, project status updates, and delivery on execution plans in a timely manner. 9. Performs post installation monitoring, ongoing business benefit impact, and capability performance tracking for Small Business. 10. Plays active role to teach, develop and enhance Data and Analytics Competency across the enterprise. 11. Collaborates with and leverages corporate shared services functions to bring the Small Business competitive strategy to life and achieve Small Business results; aligns with corporate governance while maintaining a singular focus on the small business customer. Builds and utilizes strong partnerships to drive alignment for the mutual benefit of both Small Business and the organization. 12. Travels as needed in order to perform other essential functions.  Desired Qualifications/Experience/Certification/Education (in order of importance) 1. 7+ years of experience in Analytics and/or Data Science with a broad understanding of statistical and data science methodologies and their business applications. 2. Experience explaining complex analytical solutions in a simple and effective manner to business sponsors and partners. 3. Experience with the following software/tools: o SQL o BI tools: one or more of the following:  Tableau, Qlikview, Spotfire, and/ or MSBI is required. o Statistical software: one or more of the following:  R, Python, SAS, Statistica, SPSS, or Minitab Required. 4. Strong interpersonal communication, presentation, and facilitation skills with audiences spanning from peers to executives. 5. Excellent written communication skills including ability to clearly express thoughts and ideas through documentation. 6. Capable of building and maintaining strong, collaborative relationships with business leaders and Enterprise Partners. 7. Experience performing capability gap analysis, and analyzing business problems, and presenting analytical solutions. 8. Highly motivated self-starter with an ability to effectively manage a range of tasks and projects in an environment with changing priorities. 9. Exhibit flexibility, working in a fast-paced environment requiring quick response. 10. Prior experience with Insurance, Banking and Finance. 11. Experience working in an Agile Environment. 12. Master’s Degree or higher with specializations and/or heavy course work in data analytics, statistics, predictive analytics, or data sciences OR commensurate experience. 13. Valid driver’s license and a driving record that conforms to company standards.  Physical Requirements (specific to the role) The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Ability to work effectively in an office environment for 40+ hours per week (including sitting, standing, and working on a computer for extended periods of time). Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative work environment utilizing various technologies such as: telephone, computer, web, voice, teleconferencing, e-mail, etc. Ability to travel as required. Ability to operate an automobile within the parameters of the driving policy.  This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management. Upstart is the leading AI lending platform partnering with banks to expand access to affordable credit. Forbes recently ranked Upstart #12 on its list of "most promising AI companies in America." Inc. Magazine also recognized Upstart as one of the Best Workplaces for 2020.  By leveraging Upstart's AI platform, Upstart-powered banks can have higher approval rates and lower loss rates, while simultaneously delivering the exceptional digital-first lending experience their customers demand. Upstart's patent-pending platform is the first to receive a no-action letter from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau related to fair lending. Upstart is based in San Mateo, California and Columbus, Ohio.  Most Upstarters join us because they connect with our mission of enabling access to effortless credit based on true risk. If you are energized by the impact you can make at Upstart, we'd love to hear from you!  The Team The Growth Team is in charge of expanding Upstart's reach to the millions of Americans without access to affordable credit. We are energized by the prospect of breaking ground in our field and making a positive impact on people's financial lives.  As a Growth Marketing Analyst at Upstart, you will take on the most analytical and strategic questions facing the growth team today. You'll create compelling stories, drive strategies, and uncover new opportunities by diving into numbers head first to support our two largest and most influential channels: direct mail and partnerships. P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in over 75 countries, with 65 trusted brands that improve lives for 5 billion consumers worldwide. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges.  We believe great ideas emerge from the creative connections that happen between our talented employees, and we encourage diverse, multi-functional teams to work together to generate new ideas to address challenges we face.  The Opportunity: Do you have experience working with data, advanced analytics, and creating insights? If so, then come join our North America Media Analytics & Insights team at the P&G headquarters located in Cincinnati, OH. We are looking for someone who loves solving tough business problems and brings creative thinking and ideas to drive growth behind our portfolio of P&G brands. In North America Media, you will get the chance to work on some of the world’s largest brands and top advertisers while partnering with industry leaders to transform the media data and analytics space.  Job Description: The NA Traditional Media Analytics & Insights Manager responsibilities would include: In-Market Performance: Track P&G’s in-market performance in TV, radio, and print to understand how inventory is delivering against brand goals and identify opportunities on how to adjust future plans and buys to maximize impact. Portfolio Optimization: Assess opportunities to optimize P&G’s 35+ brand portfolio’s advertising spend and inventory pool across TV, radio, and print. Innovation: Create new analytic approaches and models to solve current marketplace challenges across TV, radio, and print. Deploy new approaches across P&G brands to enable broad use and activation.  The Ideal Candidate is: Interested in analyzing data to create meaningful insights, stories, and recommendations to drive change. Passionate about driving innovation and creative solutions within a team environment. Service oriented to deliver on the unique needs of P&G categories and brands.  Required: A Bachelor’s Degree. 2+ years of experience in data analytics, or an equivalent field. Strong analytical skills and understanding of manipulating multiple data sources. Experience using Excel, JMP, or other statistical software. Experience using visualization software and tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Spotfire.  Ability to relocate to Cincinnati, OH. Preferred: Experience working with media data, systems, and tools. Specific expertise in television, radio, and print preferred. Experience working with advanced data and analytics software such as SQL, Python, R, and/or KNIME. The Value of a P&G Career Ongoing coaching and career development – you will work with passionate people and have access to best in class training through our P&G Leadership Academy as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager. We provide a market-competitive salary benchmarked against the finest companies, so you'll be able to spend your generous vacation time doing more of the things you love with the people you love. We offer a suite of benefits, including but not limited to: flexible working arrangements, generous paid vacation increasing with service, generous parental leave policies, group life insurance, health insurance, and dedicated support to help you find the right child care or elder care. Additional perks include discounted P&G products from our company shops and a discount platform offering you unbeatable savings on everything from groceries to exotic holidays. What's more, your financial package might include things like interest-free loans, a tax-advantageous share purchase plan, a contributory pension plan, and financial education and advisement on topics including purchasing real estate and generating wealth. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor. running pilot tests, implementing, and continuously improving large-scale people processes. Who We Are Twitter serves the public conversation by encouraging people all over the world to connect, learn, debate, and solve problems together. We believe conversation can change the world, and that’s why Tweeps (that’s what we call Twitter employees) come to work every day. Twitter Next is a global team of marketers, creatives, technologists, program managers, developers, and data scientists – all dedicated to dreaming up and building ideas for brands that earn attention.  “The Lab” is an embedded team within Twitter Next that specifically combines design, data science, and technology that experiment to push the limits of what’s possible on Twitter for our most ambitious brand and agency partners.  Our team’s collective purpose is to help brands activate ideas so human-centric they become “worth talking about.” It’s an ambitious goal that inspires us to constantly challenge ourselves to be bold. Conversation is Twitter’s fundamental medium, and we’re here to help brands not just be part of it – but to spark and drive it.  Who You Are A Data Scientist with an elite level of technical expertise – and a track record of infusing the resulting data and insights into the creative process. You’re passionate about how data can uncover fundamental or unexpected context that informs and inspires creative marketing, business strategy, and product development.  You’re passionate about the creative craft, and driven by a fundamental belief that data can play an outsized role in unlocking creativity and bettering the way brands and consumers communicate.  You love to extrapolate and substantiate observations. You’re endlessly curious about what makes people tick, and finding new ways to use advanced technical data-mining and statistical methodologies to understand and evaluate behaviors that reveal untapped opportunity.  You’re obsessed equally with the pursuit of information, and framing that information into simple human insight and stories for technical and non-technical audiences.  You’re fascinated by conversation, language, and the opportunity to pioneer new ways to use conversation data to reveal bigger truths about how we interact with one another.  You’re a builder, tinkerer, and experimenter. You find joy in using your technical skills to explore new techniques, technologies, and API’s to build stuff.  What You’ll Do  The Insights Scientist on this team will be responsible for using internal and external data sources to analyze and understand behavioral patterns on and off Twitter, develop unique and innovative ways of measuring the value of brand activations, build and maintain tools that make data more accessible to non-technical collaborators, and help inform our R&D prioritization and approach. You’ll partner with Strategists, Creatives, and Technologists to utilize your analysis and insight to inform, pitch, and execute Twitter ideas worth talking about on behalf of the world’s most iconic brands.  You’ll be responsible for defining the long term vision for Twitter Next Lab’s Insights Science function including the opportunity to set team priorities and objectives, resource needs, and recruit and build a team around you.  Given the leadership responsibilities of this role and the close cross-functional collaborators, excellent communication and stakeholder management skills will be critical for long-term success.  Because the Insights Science team focuses on a wide range of project types, broad curiosity and problem-solving skills are critical to success.  Responsibilities Utilize applied statistics and quantitative reasoning to help us understand how users interact with brand and cultural content on Twitter Extract usage and behavioral data from both internal and external data sources Develop expertise with internal and external 3rd party tools serving as a subject matter expert to consult and train other team members on using tools and analyzing data to create insight Conduct analyses to learn from our vast amount of data to both make it more accessible to Strategists and Creatives as well as to surface reporting and insights Apply advanced statistical techniques to model user behavior, identify causal impact and attribution, and build and benchmark metrics Measure the effectiveness of our team’s custom products and solutions using experimentation frameworks Write complex data flows using SQL, Python, R, Spark, and/or Scalding Use data visualization tools to share ongoing insights, (e.g, Tableau, Zeppelin) Adopt a client-responsive, customer service mindset; this is a role that blends analytical acumen with interpersonal skill Partner with other teams at Twitter to uncover new ways to generate creative insight Translate insights and research into recommended areas for product exploration Document analytical methodologies, best practices, and processes for repeated use and contribute to company knowledge sharing efforts Present and visualize basic data findings for communicating to brand advertisers, internal business leaders, and cross-functional product teams  Qualifications Minimum 5+ years of experience with data extraction and analysis at an agency, brand, or technology platform Mandatory experience in partnering with creative, strategy, or non-technical teams as part of the creative marketing development process Hands-on experience utilizing SQL and proprietary data extraction and analysis tools Strong written and visual communication skills for documenting and sharing methodologies and processes for wider utilization Experience translating verbal or written business problems into data solutions Familiarity with experiment design and testing at scale Ability to connect business hypotheses and real world problems to data insights  Desired Bachelor's degree Masters preferred in statistics, econometrics, computer science, or related field, or equivalent experience We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 13 days ago report job

Varo is on a mission to redefine banking so it's easy for everyone to make smart choices with their money. PREVIOUS EXPERIENCES THAT'LL HELP YOU BE GREAT 5+ years of work experience in Marketing or Product Analytics, or 3+ years experience with MBA/Master's degree 3+ years of statistical experience (creating attribution models, A/B tests or lift analysis). 3+ years of experience in SQL. Experience articulating business questions, scripting with SQL/Python to pull data from datasets and adapt quantitative techniques to solve complex problems. Poste: Lead Analyst, Advanced Analytics and Insights - B2Bnew
Description: Wayfair Analytics is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Storefront Advanced Analytics & Insights team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems. The B2B team is responsible for delivering a world-class experience to our professional customers across multiple industries, including Interior Design, Commercial Office, Contractor, Hospitality, Property Management, and Education. The B2B business has seen exciting transformations over the past few years and still has so much untapped potential as we grow towards the $100B+ opportunity in North America. As the senior technical leader for B2B Storefront Analytics, your goal is to unlock insights and guide the business – everything from tactical site optimizations to broad level strategic direction that is grounded in data evidence and heavy analytical rigor. This requires a multidisciplinary blend of analytical experience, strong technical capability, business strategy and stakeholder management, all applied in tandem to discover key insights that lie hidden in Wayfair’s web data. This position is responsible for analyzing and making data-driven recommendations to improve the full funnel experience on Wayfair Professional. This is an ideal opportunity for a high-performing individual contributor passionate about deepening their technical expertise, having increased responsibilities and impact on the business’s bottom line, and growing their career up the technical career ladder. The successful candidate will have excellent technical and analytical skills as well as the ability to present their data driven recommendations in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.  What You'll Do Work closely with all facets of the organization including product management, engineering, creative design, marketing, and data science on your focus area. Own and develop the strategic analytic agenda across the full B2B funnel to unlock insights and guide the business. Bring your expertise in A/B testing to identify, design, execute, and analyze thoughtful tests to make high-impact changes to the Wayfair Professional site experience. A few example projects include a feature model of B2B checkout to understand which attributes are driving customers to convert vs distracting, identifying and executing on the right analytical approach to determine the optimal recommendation feature(s) to include on the product page, and a customer repeat purchase cycle analysis to inform marketing strategies and site features such as “buy it again”. Proactively monitor customer behavior on the B2B site to identify potential issues, determine root causes, and resolve. Also requires knowledge of the overall site for indexing, when appropriate. Communicate key insights and recommendations to cross-functional executive leaders across the organization. Be the go-to technical and analytical expert for junior analysts on the team. Provide leadership to corporate initiatives which requires the ability to work with executives and be a thought partner with the cross functional leadership team.  What You'll Need Bachelors in computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred. 5+ years work experience in relevant field. Expert with SQL or structured computer programming language. Expert at working with large and complex SQL databases. Expert at experimental test design including A/B testing; experience with multivariate and multi-armed bandit also preferred. Proficient with a statistical programming language such as Python, R, or SAS. Proficient with a data visualization software such as Looker, Google Data Studio, or Tableau. Proficient at understanding, using, and explaining statistical techniques. Proficient at managing cross-functional stakeholders. Excellent communication and data presentation skills covering objectives, plans, status, roadblocks, and results. Demonstrated success influencing senior level stakeholders on strategic direction based on recommendations backed by in-depth analysis. Prior experience proactively identifying areas where analytical efforts can produce a strong business value add and setting the analytics roadmap. Able to manage multiple projects and deliver against aggressive goals.  About Us: Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.  No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information. 6 days ago report job

Job Description Details We want every customer to be a passionate fan of Zulily. We create highly personalized experiences throughout the customer journey which produce an incredible volume and velocity of data. We are looking for a talented Lead Analyst to lead a team dedicated to generating powerful insights about the customer experience in order to drive growth in customer retention and loyalty. This is an opportunity to be part of an innovative, data-driven culture that is changing the way data and technology are used to shape eCommerce. Your primary focus will be leveraging your passion for digging into data, structuring problems, and building analyses to identify actionable insights and maximize the impact of Zulily’s customer programs on our customer and the business. You understand the complexities surrounding customer loyalty and measurement of investment opportunities that maximize both short- and long-term profitability. You drive projects from beginning to end and communicate insights to stakeholders at all levels, from peers to executives. You enjoy being creative in your use of data-driven tools and methodologies to understand marketing levers and are eager to initiate new ideas, approaches and actions to move the business forward. What you’ll do: Own and lead projects to identify, model, and evaluate opportunities to drive growth in customer retention and loyalty. Use customer centric data analysis, data visualization, segmentation, a/b testing and predictive modeling methods to optimize the customer experience through programs such as the Zulily Credit Card, Returns and Shipping. Develop test plans and tools to measure performance, test hypotheses, develop insights and make recommendations that drive the highest incremental gains. Develop and streamline necessary reporting, dashboards and one-off analyses, providing ability to monitor the health of customer programs and effectively communicate performance. Work with stakeholders to identify multi-million dollar opportunities and facilitate data-driven decision-making. Identify opportunities across product, machine learning, and marketing that enable personalization, automation and optimization of program strategy and execution. Partner with technology teams to build out a best-in-class marketing platform and data infrastructure. Prepare and present quantitative analyses to influence peers as well as C-level leadership. Develop deep subject matter expertise and act as a Marketing Analytics subject matter expert within the Marketing organization. Rapidly integrate best practices in marketing measurement by monitoring competitive landscape and industry standards. Effectively lead through others to drive highest priority business impact. Raise the bar on coaching and mentorship. Who you are: An experienced analytical leader who loves digging into data, structuring problems, and building analyses, translating them into actionable business recommendations. A background in eCommerce and the passion to drive customer growth using data-driven insights. 5+ years in digital analytics working with customer and marketing data. Experience managing or mentoring analysts in a formal or informal capacity. Bachelor's degree in quantitative or computer science field or equivalent experience. Deep understanding of experiment design and diversity of methodologies to measure impact of customer experience programs and project deliverables. Advanced capabilities in extracting and manipulating large data sets using SQL or similar. Skilled in Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau (or similar dashboard software). Familiarity with R or Python preferred. Proven ability to lead cross-functionally and communicate effectively with other areas of the business. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong bias for action and experience in a high paced, high volume multi-tasking role and environment. You’re not afraid to be hands-on as needed. About Zulily, LLC Zulily, LLC, is a retailer obsessed with bringing its customers special finds every day—all at incredible prices. zulily features an always-fresh curated collection for the whole family, including clothing, home decor, toys, gifts and more. Unique products from up-and-coming brands are featured alongside favorites from top brands, giving customers something new to discover each morning. zulily was launched in 2010 and is headquartered in Seattle with offices in Nevada, Ohio and Pennsylvania. For more information visit www.zulily.com . zulily, LLC, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Qurate Retail, Inc. (NASDAQ: QRTEA, RTEB), which includes QVC, HSN, Zulily and the Cornerstone brands (collectively, “Qurate Retail Group”), as well as other minority investments. Qurate Retail Group believes in a third way to shop - beyond transactional ecommerce or traditional brick-and-mortar stores - and is #1 in video commerce, #3 in ecommerce in North America and #3 in mobile commerce in the U.S. (according to Internet Retailer). For more information, visit www.qurateretailgroup.com . EEO As an equal opportunity employer, Qurate Retail Group is committed to a diverse workforce and is also committed to a barrier-free employment process. This requires a multidisciplinary blend of analytical experience, strong technical capability, and business strategy, all applied in tandem to discover key insights that lie hidden in Wayfair’s web data. This is a highly visible and strategic position that is responsible for directly leading a team of analysts to understand customer and supplier behavior, optimize Media spend strategy for our suppliers through real time auction and display campaigns and help develop features across our customer and supplier facing sites. Proactively identify areas where analytical efforts can produce a strong business value add and setting the analytics road map. Provide leadership to corporate initiatives which requires the ability to work with executives and be a thought partner with cross functional leadership team. Communicate key insights and recommendations to cross-functional executive leaders across the organization Prioritize resources and hiring across multiple areas and balancing short-term needs with longer-term initiatives. Excellent communication and data presentation skills covering objectives, plans, status, roadblocks, and results. Prior experience proactively identifying areas where analytical efforts can produce a strong business value add and setting the analytics roadmap. Experience designing and implementing highly visible, and innovative analytical organizations Strong business acumen, analytical skills and technical abilities along with problem solving skills. Summary Posted: Feb 13, 2020 Role Number:200114473 Apple Silicon Engineering is seeking creative Senior Layout Leads to design the next generation of Apple’s world-leading systems-on-chip (SOCs). Apple’s multi-billion-transistor Ax SOCs are the brain of every iPhone and iPad. Our Analog/Mixed-Signal (AMS) circuits connect them to the physical world. Examples of our AMS IPs include SERDES for data communication, PLLs for clock generation, and sensors for measuring all sorts of physical quantities. Analog Layout is a crucial component of the hardware design process. Analog Layout Engineers work alongside circuit designers to transform design ideas into silicon. Apple’s world-leading SOCs are created using robust tool-suites, the most advanced nodes, and modern layout methodologies. Description: Music for everyone, no credit card needed. It’s a promise our platform was built on. And here in the Free team, we’re still building on it. We work on a massive scale, bringing people from all kinds of disciplines and all parts of the business together to deliver an amazing freemium experience to more than 129 million users worldwide. Want to help shape the future of free? Here’s how. We are looking for an experienced leader in data science and analytics to join our team and help build our practice. We are developing a world-class advertising business at Spotify, and your team will develop insights and products that drive data informed decision making to help us meet our goals. The data science and analytics team in this area will be helping to answer questions such as: How are trends in listener behavior changing and how might these changes inform our ad sales, B2B marketing and product strategies? How do we segment our audiences to provide maximum value to advertising partners? How well is our performance matching our goals and can we uncover specific areas to focus on improvement or double down on success? How well are we marketing our ad products to prospective clients? How can we best expand our client base?What new insights can we uncover that may be useful to our existing and potential clients? How can we optimize our pricing across regions, platforms and products? As a Senior Manager in the Ads Business unit you’ll report to the Senior Director of data and insights and build/lead a team of around 7 data scientists and analysts. What you’ll do Help build and then lead a team of data scientists and analysts, setting focus, strategy and priorities with the team to maximize influence and impact in the organization. Work with senior leadership across Ad Sales, Sales Operations, Partner Solutions and Revenue Partnerships to understand analytic needs and deliver impactful findings. Collaborate with insight partners across the organization and contribute to the wider data science practice. Team responsibilities include delivering the following: – Data infrastructure – Dashboards and key metrics – Audience segmentation – Exploratory analysis and forecasting of trends – Marketing attribution – Experimentation. Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key stakeholders at the Director, VP and Executive levels. Work closely with cross-functional teams. Work from New York, leading research across our global markets. Who you are You have 3+ years of experience as a people-manager. You have at least 7+ years of overall experience in data analytics or data science and an advanced degree in statistics or similar discipline. You have worked on data science problems related to advertising platforms, marketing functions or sales. You have the technical competence to perform and coach team members in more advanced analytics: Coding skills for analytics and data extraction (SQL, R, Python, Scala) Data visualization (such as Tableau, D3, ggplot) Experience performing analysis with large databases (e.g. Google BigQuery) Experience building statistical models and running experiments You are a great storyteller and communicator, and can build relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders. You are capable of tackling ambiguous problem spaces and challenges. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be brilliant. So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens. Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the opportunity to enjoy and be inspired by these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 286 million users. 1 day ago report job

Job Description: The Wall Street Journal’s Opinion section is looking for a data analyst to help deliver critical digital insights and visualizations to help guide strategy. This person will also be instrumental in the creation of new dashboards and metrics that will help with audience segmentation projects. The role provides daily research support to the team and responsibilities include daily, weekly, and quarterly data reviews of Opinion content, analysis of historical and planned articles, and collaboration with other data teams in developing audience insights. The Wall Street Journal has a large digital audience that is quickly growing. As we grow, we are dedicated to understanding all of our audiences and the value we provide them. The data analyst will also work with WSJ team members on our Programming and News Insights teams, which is using data science and predictive modeling to help us engage better with our audiences. United under the banner “free markets, free people,” The Wall Street Journal Opinion section has long served as a forum for intelligent, values-driven commentary. While we aim to persuade, every word we publish is the product of rigorous reporting, research and debate. And though we uphold the same standards, we operate with complete independence from the newsroom. The Data Analyst will have: The ability to manage, organize and present data in a clear, concise and actionable format Great communication skills to be able to teach editors and reporters how to use tools and think about audience data The ability to turn raw data into visual insights to help support content decisions. Flexible workflow and ability to manage multiple assignments in a dynamic environment Creativity and strong critical thinking skills Top candidates will have strengths in multiple areas of the following: Skills appropriate for advanced visual and data journalism, including knowledge of D3 and Illustrator; command of HTML, CSS and JS Knowledge of Python (preferred) or R Experience working in SQL Familiarity with statistical and significance tests Experience with Linux and cloud-based services. Experience with Tableau or Looker is helpful but not required. Knowledge of data analytics tools, including Omniture, Google Analytics, Parse.ly or Chartbeat Dow Jones , Making Careers Newsworthy All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets . Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com . Please put “Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line. Business Area: EDITORIAL Job Category: Customer Service/Support Group About Us Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News. This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day. If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you. At a glance: This is an Associate Director level position on our Marketing Analytics team with a core responsibility of training and leading a team to work with internal and external clients to analyze marketing data to provide actionable insights and optimization to improve upon our client’s business objectives. If not based in Portland, Oregon, periodic travel to the area will be required for key in-person meetings. What does an Associate Director, Marketing Analytics do at Rain the Growth Agency?  Support media optimization initiatives for all platforms – TV, print, radio, OOH, website, OTT, email, etc. Support clients, internal teams, and executives through interpreting multiple regression modeling results. Confidently discuss modeling techniques with potential clients in the pitch process. Manage, train, and mentor team to grow capabilities of existing team members in analytics and statistics Assist Media Planners to develop actionable insight beyond standard reporting to drive strategic marketing direction. Produce performance reports (e.g. scorecards, dashboards, ad-hoc reports) for clients, and ability to recognize and troubleshoot data anomalies. Assist with ad-hoc marketing campaign analyses, mining for deep insights that will drive business results and inform strategic planning and optimization. Ensure data integrity by leveraging media analytics reporting suites (Adobe/Omniture, Google Analytics, Campaign Manager, Datorama and the breadth of proprietary analytic tools. Work to integrate new tools and stay on top on industry trends in Analytics and Predictive Modeling to best support Media Planners Lead improvement projects to revamp existing tools and appropriately beta test them internally and with clients.  Develop a strong partnerships and collaboration with internal team member and clients. Present project specific findings to internal and client team members and collect feedback to refine future analysis. Actively listen to needs of others to understand and provide accurate information or solutions. Be the “go to person” on each of their client account teams with little assistance from the Director. Knows when and when not to escalate issues or problems to the Director. Be a strong backup for the Director when she is out traveling to pitches. Helps build up direct reports to be able to work independently as well.  Support the Marketing Analytics team. Set up and maintain client campaign tracking, data collection, and client reporting. Prepare presentation slides, analytic reports and other visualizations of status meetings. Prioritize multiple projects and tasks simultaneously and adapt to changes quickly. Cross train other team members within the department Share new findings, tools, code, etc. with the department Work closely with the Digital Analytics team to support and collaborate  What makes a great Associate Director, Marketing Analytics at our agency?  Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, statistics) or Business/Marketing. Master’s degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics) or Business/Marketing (a plus, but not required) 10-15 years’ experience Knowledge of analytics and reporting Digital analytics experience a plus Ability to apply statistical techniques independently to generate practical solutions for business problems in both the big picture and fine details Experience with analytics for cross-platform media campaigns (TV, digital, paid social, YouTube) Proficient statistical programming skills (R, SQL, or Python) Mastery of Microsoft Excel Ability to meet tight deadlines and maintain strong attention to detail in a fast-paced environment Strong written and verbal communication, and presentation skills Collaborative team member with a natural sense of curiosity Strong problem solving and decision making skills Ability to present in small and large groups Strong attention to detail Appreciation of Rain the Growth Agency’s Core Values Why work at Rain the Growth Agency?  We are a national leader in DTC marketing. We do a thing we call Transactional Brand Building. That is, we deliver on our clients’ brand and sales objectives at the same time, with the same work and the same media plan. We measure our clients’ sales results daily – per transaction, so you and your clients can see the tangible results of your work. It’s an exhilarating standard to live up to. There are about 240 of us, so we’re big enough to handle major projects, but small enough that we all know each other. We are collaborative. We care about, appreciate, and respect each other. No throwing under buses. Transparency. We all know how the company is doing and where we’re going, collectively and individually. We have a large and diverse roster of clients, and we get our revenue from a variety of sources, so we’re built for stability. You’ll get to work on a variety of accounts, with different team members, so you’ll never be bored We are privately held, so we answer only to our clients and to each other. 21 days ago report job

launches via analytics for large public figures in conjunction with cross-functional teams Build internal dashboards to support Partnerships and other teams within the company Analyze and segment figures, especially related to video Manage requests and priorities while creating presentations for internal use with cross-functional teams or external use with partners Identify areas of our The Challenge Adobe’s Document Cloud Strategy & Insights team is looking for a Data Insights & Analytics Manager who is passionate about using big data to deliver phenomenal customer experiences and to inform business decisions. You’ll be responsible for driving tactical insights for product usage and customer retention. Additionally, you should have experience working in cross functional environments, leading change, and presenting optimally to executive and non-technical audiences. What you’ll do Help develop compelling “stories” that convey the meaningful synthesized insights in a compelling manner to various internal partner audiences Partner with various cross-functional teams (Engagement & Retention, Data Science, Finance, Engineering, Product, and Marketing) to understand business requirements through our Data Driven Operating Model, provide in-depth data analytics support and share associated business insights Perform regular ad-hoc SQL data querying in Hadoop to provide analysis to better understand customer behaviors including acquisition, engagement, conversion, and retention Design and develop informative analytics deliverables, projections and target settings, via a variety of statistical tools and techniques including requirements capturing, data profiling, data analysis, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, use case definition, data visualization, and data storytelling Capture, synthesize, and interpret disparate quantitative data within the context of business objectives, identify trends, and explore data through segments and cohorts Implement engagement and retention business models, test and optimize the customer experience, and monitor the outcomes in support of the Engagement & Retention team’s initiatives Improve and automate data tasks, and continuously refresh existing data extraction, aggregation, and analytical processes What you’ll need to succeed BA/BS in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or other quantitative fields. Master is preferred. 5 - 10 Years of industry experience in data/business analysis or a related field A strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets for analytical purposes using SQL-like languages (Hive/Hadoop experience preferred) Familiarity with big data platforms such as Hadoop Experience with programming language such as Python, R Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI Statistical Modelling in Microsoft Excel or Power Pivot Understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining concepts, and a record of solving problems with these methods. Description: By applying for this role, you could choose to work in the following locations: US - Remote US San Francisco  What You’ll Do: Defending the health and integrity of the public conversation is Twitter’s top priority. The Health Data Science Team partners with Product, Engineering, and Policy to rigorously understand and quantify Twitter's highly complex and adversarial Health space and use this understanding to empower the Health Organization to better protect our users.  Who You Are: As a data science manager you build cohesive, high-functioning teams that thrive in a culture of trust, respect, and inclusion. You balance autonomy with guidance by giving your team the tools, context, confidence, and motivation to make decisions effectively and independently. You have the technical capacity to partner with tech leads and are comfortable diving into the fray to help drive resolutions in the case of bad incidents.  You take responsibility for the group’s short-term and long-term strategy, define the team's roadmap, success metrics, and priorities in close collaboration with multi-functional partners and inspire your team to independently do the same.  You are great at: Understanding consumer products and their vulnerability to manipulation and subversion Collaborating with PMs, engineers, and designers to drive product impact Leading and prioritizing projects Nurturing the career growth of data scientists Requirements: 6+ years of relevant experience in Data Science or adjacent roles. 3+ years of experience managing Data Scientists Expertise solving complex and highly impactful quantitative problems with at least one scripting language (Python, R, etc.) and SQL. Preferred Qualifications: A PhD or advanced degree in a quantitative field or commensurate experience Domain expertise in statistical inference Relevant Health or Platform Integrity domain expertise Work experience at a large tech company Expertise with quantitative analytics tools at scale with technologies such as Spark. The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. As a leader in a corporation with 83,000 employees and agency force members, you’ll have a hand in transforming not only Allstate but a dynamic industry. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities. Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Description This role sits in our Charlotte talent center and requires candidates to be local to the area. This is not a remote role. Where good people build rewarding careers. Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.  Department Summary The Data, Discovery and Decision Science (D3) department leverages data and analytics to help the enterprise make data driven decisions that improve business processes, create great customer experiences, and deliver on our corporate priorities. D3 is responsible for supporting business units across the Allstate Family of Companies (AFC) with a broad portfolio of data, research, and analytical products and solutions. A fast-growing team of highly skilled professionals, D3 provides a unique learning environment through formal training curriculum, mentoring, coaching, challenging hands-on assignments, and a collaborative culture as we develop the analytical experts and leaders of tomorrow.  Role Summary As part of the analytics Portfolio & Operations Management organization in D3, Business Analytics Consultants (BACs) use a mix of business consulting, technical, and solution implementation skills to help D3 deliver on our commitments. In a highly technical environment, we are relied upon to provide business, communication, and project execution expertise to bridge the gap between business problems and technical (both data and analytic) solutions. Our mission is to maximize (and accelerate) the business value of data & analytics while developing the leaders of tomorrow. The D3 BAC Consultant I position is a junior-level consultant position that will use business and technical acumen to support the development of data and analytical processes, solutions, and products in alignment with a business or data platform focused area. The Jr. BAC is responsible for clear communication among stakeholders and ensuring project(s)/product(s) are fulfilling all agreed upon criteria when delivered. Additionally, the BAC Analyst will be exposed to the ins and outs of developing data strategies and products for predictive analytic applications, fundamental skills of big data, data science and statistical learning methods, and agile delivery methodologies. Key Responsibilities This is a general BAC position for assignment to a team developing either analytics or data solutions. Technical exposure or experience in data science and data platform development is a plus. Identify and prioritize new opportunities for analytics through the following business consulting responsibilities: Strategy, Business, & Process Consulting: Develops a good tactical understanding of core business problems, processes, and data lineage. Looks for opportunities to use advanced analytics or develop data solutions. Supports in identifying where data and analytics could be leveraged in order to make key business decisions. Supports activities to develop strategies and identify high priority initiatives. Experimentation, Research & Innovation: Keeps up with industry and technology developments to identify new analytic tools, methods, and techniques relevant to business needs. Contributes to an enterprise testing mindset, and experiments where possible. Relationship Management & Communication: Supports efforts to build new relationships and maintain current relationships with business stakeholders both internal and external of D3. Assists to ensure collaboration, transparency, alignment, and engagement across the stakeholder landscape. Program Coordination: Supports the management and coordination of resources to match the development of analytics solutions to business timelines, value goals, and outcomes. Supports the integration of delivery structures. Helps teams identify and resolve challenges.  Implement and operationalize analytical insights, products and solutions through the following technical and solution implementation responsibilities: Agile Program Execution: With direction, supports moderately complex projects/products and is responsible for coordinating activities for smaller/lower impact projects/products from ideation to delivery in an Agile framework, with an emphasis on measurable, value add deliverables. Technical Support of Analytics Development Life Cycle: Supports high level model/data product design by providing Data Scientists and Engineers with business requirements, creating data visualizations, and providing an understanding of data domains and their impact to the business. Data Visualization & Storytelling: Understands the fundamentals of data visualization and develops solutions using technical tools like Tableau and storytelling techniques in order to effectively communicate and supports the connection of data and analytics solutions to business priorities for non-technical audiences. Implementation & User Adoption: Supports the development and execution of change management action plans. Supports putting data and analytics into production through coordination and subject matter knowledge.
